user_prompt: Java code requirement: Input to this function is a string represented multiple groups for nested parentheses separated by spaces. For each of the group, output the deepest level of nesting of parentheses. E.g. (()()) has maximum two levels of nesting while ((())) has three.   student code: import java.util.*; class Solution5 { public List<Integer> parseNestedParens(String paren_string) { List<Integer> res = new ArrayList<>(); String[] parts = paren_string.split(" "); for (String group : parts) { if (group.isEmpty()) continue; int depth = 0, maxDepth = 0; for (char c : group.toCharArray()) { if (c == '(') { depth++; maxDepth = Math.max(maxDepth, depth); } else depth--; } res.add(maxDepth); } return res; } }
feedback: Correct solution.

For each of the group, output the deepest level of nesting of parentheses. E.g. (()()) has maximum two levels of nesting while ((())) has three.   student code: import java.util.*; class Solution14 { public List<Integer> parseNestedParens(String paren_string) { List<Integer> result = new ArrayList<>(); String[] groups = paren_string.split(" "); for (String g : groups) { if (g.isEmpty()) continue; int depth = 0, maxDepth = 0; for (char c : g.toCharArray()) { if (c == '(') { depth++; maxDepth = Math.max(maxDepth, depth); } else if (c == ')') depth--; } result.add(maxDepth); } return result; } }

user_prompt: Java code requirement: Given list of integers, return list in strange order. Strange sorting, is when you start with the minimum value, then maximum of the remaining integers, then minimum and so on. Examples: strangeSortList(Arrays.asList(1, 2, 3, 4)) == Arrays.asList(1, 4, 2, 3), strangeSortList(Arrays.asList(5, 5, 5, 5)) == Arrays.asList(5, 5, 5, 5), strangeSortList(Arrays.asList()) == Arrays.asList(). student code: import java.util.*; class Solution { public List<Integer> strangeSortList(List<Integer> lst) { List<Integer> res = new ArrayList<>(); boolean _switch = true; List<Integer> l = new ArrayList<>(lst); while (l.size() != 0) { if (_switch) { res.add(Collections.min(l)); } else { res.add(Collections.max(l)); } l.remove(Integer.valueOf(res.get(res.size() - 1))); _switch = _switch; } return res; } }
feedback: 1) Logical Error: Setting _switch = _switch instead of _switch = !_switch; variable never toggles, causing incorrect alternation pattern.
